intro: Cyanea grimesiana, commonly known as the Haleakalā Cyanea, is a rare and endemic flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant thrives in the wet, shaded environments of the upper elevations of Haleakalā, where it forms dense mats on rocky substrates. Due to habitat loss and introduced species, it is listed as endangered, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a significant species in Hawaiian flora.
